results.title: The Decline of western civilization
results.brief_description: Documentary filmed December 1979 through May 1980 in Los Angeles, California on the hard-core punk rock culture movement that existed at the time. Features a cross-section of some of the prominent Los Angeles bands performing live on stage at The Arena, The Fleetwood, Club 88, Hong Kong Cafe and Cherrywood Studios, including Alice Bag Band, Black Flag, Catholic Discipline, Circle Jerks, Fear, Germs, and X. Also includes some insightful interviews with members of the bands, punk fans and music industry moguls as they discuss their lives, the punk phenomenon and their philosophy on life. WARNING: Contains strong use of language and some violent scenes.

results.title: Tommy by The Who
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell, Robert Stigwood and Robert Stigwood Organisation
results.brief_description: Tommy by The Who is based upon the Rock Opera by Pete Townshend with additional material by John Entwistle and Keith Moon. It is the story of a deaf, dumb and blind boy who is eventually cured and becomes a rock celebrity. Features Oliver Reed, Ann-Margret, Roger Daltrey and Elton John with guest appearances by Eric Clapton, John Entwistle, Keith Moon, Paul Nicholas, Jack Nicholson, Robert Powell, Pete Townshend and Tina Turner.

results.title: Unfaithfully yours (1984)
results.creator_credit: Howard Zieff, Daniel Melnick, Joe Wizan, Marvin Worth and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This remake of the 1948 Preston Sturges classic stars Dudley Moore as the symphony conductor who imagines ways to get back at the wife he believes is unfaithful to him. As his jeaslousy escalates, the disastrous after-shocks provide an arrary of farcical situations as Claude lays traps, fantasizes about double murder and sets about stalking his prey. Also stars Armand Assante and Natassja Kinski.

results.title: Rocket man = Rocketman
results.creator_credit: Stuart Gillard, Roger Birnbaum, Caravan Pictures and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Light-weight comedy about the first manned mission to Mars. Chaos rules when Fred Z. Randall (Harland Williams) is called in as a last minute replacement to join the team of specialists, including the efficient Julie Ford (Jessica Lundy) and the trained chimp Ulysses. The vague and geeky Randall blunders from one disaster to the next as the mission rockets its way to Mars but he wins out in the end when his navigational skills save the day. Filmed on location at Houston and the Johnson Space Center. Cast also includes William Sadler, Jeffrey DeMunn, Beau Bridges.

results.title: Return to Oz
results.creator_credit: Walter Murch, Paul Maslansky and Oz Productions
results.brief_description: Based on L. Frank Baum’s two follow-up books to The Wizard of Oz, “Return to Oz” is not quite the frolicking musical fantasy of the original family film and it may prove a bit too scary for the younger viewer. Dorothy (Fairuza Balk), since returning home from the Land of Oz, cannot clear her head of the wonderful adventures and amazing characters she had come to know and love. Auntie Em, determined to rid Dorothy of all this Oz nonsense, sends her off for psychiatric treatment at a sanitarium. However, Dorothy is rescued by a mysterious girl and just as mysteriously ends up back in the Land of Oz where all is not as it was and the magical fantasy begins to turn into a nightmare adventure. Cast includes Nicol Williamson, Jean Marsh, Piper Laurie, Matt Clark. Parental guidance recommended.

results.title: Shanghai noon
results.creator_credit: Tom Dey, Gary Barber, Jonathan Glickman, Roger Birnbaum, Jackie Chan Films, Spyglass Entertainment and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A case of East meets West in this comic adventure Jackie Chan film set in 1850s American West. Chon Wang (Jackie Chan), an Imperial Guard, is sent across to America as part of a rescue team to find the Emperor’s kidnapped daughter, Princess Pei Pei (Lucy Liu). However it is not long before Chon Wang becomes separated from the search party and finds himself lost out in the vast open spaces of the West where he has a timely encounter with a bright but arrogant train robber by the name of Roy O’Bannon (Owen Wilson). The two become unlikely allies. Cast also includes Brandon Merrill, Roger Yuan.

results.title: Down and out in Beverly Hills
results.creator_credit: Paul Mazursky, Pato Guzman and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A wealthy but bitterly unhappy married couple take in a tramp who attempts suicide in their pool. Becoming ensconced in their lives, the tramp (played by Nick Nolte) facilitates a re-evaluation of the family’s dubious moral codes. A remake of Jean Renoir’s 1932 film “Boudu saved from drowning” this hilarious comedy with Richard Dreyfuss and Bette Midler as the warring couple, garnered many accolades and was nominated for two Golden Globes.

results.title: The Last flight of Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Charles Jarrott, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: When a vintage B-29 bomber strays from its course over the Pacific, its crew - a high-living pilot, a prim missionary and two stowaway orphans - is forced to beach it on an unmapped tropical island. Stranded, they plot their way back to civilization. Stars Elliott Gould, Genevieve Bujold, Ricky Schroder, and Vincent Gardenia.

results.title: Tin men
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A tale of two hustlers in competition with each other, one a smooth-talking ladies’ man, the other a loser surrounded by debt and emotional problems. Set in 1960s Baltimore, BB Bakowsky (Richard Dreyfus) and Ernest Tilley (Danny De Vito) are rival aluminium siding salesmen brought together through an unfortunate car accident. Each blames the other and a full-on feud ensues. Revenge becomes a game and BB succeeds in making life even more complicated when in order to infuriate Tilley, he attempts to sleep with Tilley’s wife, Nora (Barbara Hershey) only to end up falling in love with her. Although the dialogue is fast and furious with many hilarious scenes there is sense of a darker sadder story underneath. Cast includes John Mahoney, Seymour Cassel, Jackie Gayle.

results.title: Mondo New York
results.creator_credit: Harvey Keith, Stuart Shapiro and International Harmony Productions
results.brief_description: A young woman wanders the clubs and streets of New York City in the mid 1980s in search of entertainment or just to seek out the freaks. She sees avant-garde style musicians, spoken word performances, junkies, sadomasochistic shows and comedians of the era. Not a narrative but more a compilation of performances, ‘Mondo New York’ is a glimpse of a moment in time, when the punk ethos of ‘shocking behaviour’ and being ‘alternative’ were celebrated in the arts/under world. Some scenes and language may offend and some animals ARE harmed in the making of this picture. Performers featured include: Lydia Lunch, Joey Arias, Rick Aviles, Charlie Barnett, Joe Coleman, Phoebe Legre and Ann Magnuson.
